ccanalyser cli documentation¶

ccanalyser¶

Parameters

Base of all ccanalyser cli commands. Type -h or –help after any subcommand for more information.

ccanalyser [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

fastq-deduplicate¶

Parameters

Identifies PCR duplicate fragments from Fastq files

ccanalyser fastq-deduplicate [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

identify¶

Parameters

Identifies fragments with duplicated sequences.

Takes the input of the parse subcommand and deduplicates the hashed sequences using a python dictionary. Duplicate read ids (hashed) are output as a .json file.

param input_files

Paths to json files containing dictionaries with hashed read ids as the keys and hashed sequences as the values.

type input_files

Tuple

param output

Duplicate read ids identified. Defaults to “duplicates.json”.

type output

os.PathLike, optional

ccanalyser fastq-deduplicate identify [OPTIONS] [INPUT_FILES]...

Options

-o, --output <output>¶

Required Output file

Arguments

INPUT_FILES¶

Optional argument(s)

parse¶

Parameters

Parses fastq file(s) into easy to deduplicate format.

Generates a hashed (using xxhash) dictionary in json format for deduplication using identify.

param input_files

One or more fastq files to process

type input_files

Tuple

param output

Output for parsed read identifiers and sequences. Defaults to “out.json”.

type output

os.PathLike, optional

param read_buffer

Number of reads to process before outputting to file. Defaults to 1e5.

type read_buffer

int, optional

ccanalyser fastq-deduplicate parse [OPTIONS] [INPUT_FILES]...

Options

-o, --output <output>¶

File to store hashed sequence identifiers

--read_buffer <read_buffer>¶

Number of reads to process before writing to file

Arguments

INPUT_FILES¶

Optional argument(s)

remove¶

Parameters

Removes fragments with duplicated sequences from fastq files.

Reads fastq files and removes all duplicate entries provided by the duplicated ids file. Uses the output of the identify subcommand to identify and remove all sequence duplicates.

param input_files

Input fastq files (in the same order as used for the parse command).

type input_files

Tuple

param duplicated_ids

Duplicated read ids from identify command (hashed and in json format).

type duplicated_ids

os.PathLike

param read_buffer

Number of reads to process before writing to file. Defaults to 1e5.

type read_buffer

int, optional

param output_prefix

Deduplicated fastq output prefix. Defaults to “”.

type output_prefix

os.PathLike, optional

param gzip

Determines if output is gzip compressed using pigz. Defaults to False.

type gzip

bool, optional

param compression_level

Level of compression if required (1-9). Defaults to 5.

type compression_level

int, optional

param sample_name

Name of sample processed e.g. DOX-treated_1. Defaults to “”.

type sample_name

str, optional

param stats_prefix

Output prefix for statistics. Defaults to “”.

type stats_prefix

os.PathLike, optional

ccanalyser fastq-deduplicate remove [OPTIONS] [INPUT_FILES]...

Options

-o, --output_prefix <output_prefix>¶

Output prefix for deduplicated fastq file(s)

-d, --duplicated_ids <duplicated_ids>¶

Path to duplicate ids, identified by the identify subcommand

--read_buffer <read_buffer>¶

Number of reads to process before writing to file

--gzip, --no-gzip¶

Determines if files are gziped or not

--compression_level <compression_level>¶

Level of compression for output files

--sample_name <sample_name>¶

Name of sample e.g. DOX_treated_1

--stats_prefix <stats_prefix>¶

Output prefix for stats file

Arguments

INPUT_FILES¶

Optional argument(s)

fastq-digest¶

Parameters

Performs in silico digestion of one or a pair of fastq files.

param input_fastq

Input fastq files to process

type input_fastq

Tuple

param restriction_enzyme

Restriction enzyme name or site to use for digestion.

type restriction_enzyme

str

param mode

Digest combined(flashed) or non-combined(pe). Undigested pe reads are output but flashed are not written. Defaults to “pe”.

type mode

str, optional

param output_file

Output fastq file path. Defaults to “out.fastq.gz”.

type output_file

os.PathLike, optional

param minimum_slice_length

Minimum allowed length for in silico digested reads. Defaults to 18.

type minimum_slice_length

int, optional

param compression_level

Compression level for gzip output (1-9). Defaults to 5.

type compression_level

int, optional

param n_cores

Number of digestion processes to use. Defaults to 1.

type n_cores

int, optional

param read_buffer

Number of reads to process before writing to file. Defaults to 100000.

type read_buffer

int, optional

param stats_prefix

Output prefix for stats file. Defaults to “”.

type stats_prefix

os.PathLike, optional

param keep_cutsite

Determines if cutsite is removed from the output. Defaults to False.

type keep_cutsite

bool, optional

param sample_name

Name of sample processed eg. DOX-treated_1. Defaults to ‘’.

type sample_name

str, optional

ccanalyser fastq-digest [OPTIONS] [INPUT_FASTQ]...

Options

-r, --restriction_enzyme <restriction_enzyme>¶

Restriction enzyme name or sequence

-m, --mode <mode>¶

Digestion mode

Options

flashed | pe

-o, --output_file <output_file>¶
-p, --n_cores <n_cores>¶
--minimum_slice_length <minimum_slice_length>¶
--keep_cutsite <keep_cutsite>¶
--compression_level <compression_level>¶

Level of compression for output files

--read_buffer <read_buffer>¶

Number of reads to process before writing to file

--stats_prefix <stats_prefix>¶

Output prefix for stats file

--sample_name <sample_name>¶

Name of sample e.g. DOX_treated_1

Arguments

INPUT_FASTQ¶

Optional argument(s)

fastq-split¶

Parameters

Splits fastq file(s) into equal chunks of n reads.

param input_files

Input fastq files to process.

type input_files

Tuple

param method

Use the python or unix (faster but not guarenteed to mantain read pairings between R1 and R2) method to split the fastq files. Defaults to “unix”.

type method

str, optional

param output_prefix

Output prefix for split fastq files. Defaults to “split”.

type output_prefix

os.PathLike, optional

param compression_level

Compression level for gzipped output. Defaults to 5.

type compression_level

int, optional

param n_reads

Number of reads to split the input fastq files into. Defaults to 1000000.

type n_reads

int, optional

param gzip

Gzip compress output files if True. Defaults to True.

type gzip

bool, optional

ccanalyser fastq-split [OPTIONS] [INPUT_FILES]...

Options

-m, --method <method>¶

Method to use for splitting

Options

python | unix

-o, --output_prefix <output_prefix>¶

Output prefix for deduplicated fastq file(s)

--compression_level <compression_level>¶

Level of compression for output files

-n, --n_reads <n_reads>¶

Number of reads per fastq file

--gzip, --no-gzip¶

Determines if files are gziped or not

Arguments

INPUT_FILES¶

Optional argument(s)

genome-digest¶

Parameters

Generates a bed formatted file of all restriction fragments.

Digests the supplied genome fasta file and generates a bed file containing the locations of all restriction fragments produced by the supplied restriction enzyme

param input_fasta

Path to fasta file containing whole genome sequence, split by chromosome

type input_fasta

os.PathLike

param recognition_site

Restriction enzyme name/ Sequence of recognition site.

type recognition_site

str

param logfile

Output path of the digestion logfile. Defaults to genome_digest.log.

type logfile

os.PathLike, optional

param output_file

Output path for digested chromosome bed file. Defaults to genome_digest.bed.

type output_file

os.PathLike, optional

param remove_cutsite

Determines if restriction site is removed. Defaults to True.

type remove_cutsite

bool, optional

ccanalyser genome-digest [OPTIONS] INPUT_FASTA

Options

-r, --recognition_site <recognition_site>¶

Required Recognition enzyme or sequence

-l, --logfile <logfile>¶

Path for digestion log file

-o, --output_file <output_file>¶

Output file path

--remove_cutsite <remove_cutsite>¶

Exclude the recognition sequence from the output

Arguments

INPUT_FASTA¶

Required argument

interactions-bedgraph¶

Parameters

Extracts a bedgraph for a specific capture probe/ all capture probes present in a cooler file.

Bedgraph can be normalised for the number of cis interactions and/or binned into even genomic windows.

param cooler_fn

Path to hdf5 file containing cooler groups.

type cooler_fn

os.PathLike

param capture_names

Name of capture probe to extract. If None, will process all probes present in the file. Defaults to None.

type capture_names

list, optional

param output_prefix

Output file prefix for bedgraph. Defaults to “”.

type output_prefix

os.PathLike, optional

param normalise

Normalise counts using the number of cis interactions. Defaults to False.

type normalise

bool, optional

param binsize

Genomic binsize to use for generating bedgraph. No binning performed if less than 0. Defaults to 0.

type binsize

int, optional

param gzip

Compress output bedgraph with gzip. Defaults to True.

type gzip

bool, optional

param scale_factor

Scaling factor for normalisation. Defaults to 1e6.

type scale_factor

int, optional

param sparse

Produce bedgraph containing just positive bins (True) or all bins (False). Defaults to True.

type sparse

bool, optional

ccanalyser interactions-bedgraph [OPTIONS] COOLER_FN

Options

-n, --capture_names <capture_names>¶

Capture to extract and convert to bedgraph, if not provided will transform all.

-o, --output_prefix <output_prefix>¶

Output prefix for bedgraphs

--normalise¶

Normalised bedgraph (Correct for number of cis reads)

--binsize <binsize>¶

Binsize to use for converting bedgraph to evenly sized genomic bins

--gzip¶

Compress output using gzip

--scale_factor <scale_factor>¶

Scale factor to use for bedgraph normalisation

--sparse, --dense¶

Produce bedgraph containing just positive bins (sparse) or all bins (dense)

Arguments

COOLER_FN¶

Required argument

interactions-count¶

Parameters

Determines the number of captured restriction fragment interactions genome wide.

param reporters

Reporter tsv file path.

type reporters

os.PathLike

param output

Output file path for interaction counts tsv. Defaults to ‘counts.tsv’.

type output

os.PathLike, optional

param remove_exclusions

Removes regions marked as capture proximity exclusions before counting. Defaults to False.

type remove_exclusions

bool, optional

param remove_capture

Removes all capture fragments before counting. Defaults to False.

type remove_capture

bool, optional

param subsample

Subsamples the fragments by the specified fraction. Defaults to 0 i.e. No subsampling.

type subsample

int, optional

ccanalyser interactions-count [OPTIONS] REPORTERS

Options

-o, --output <output>¶

Name of output file

--remove_exclusions¶

Prevents analysis of fragments marked as proximity exclusions

--remove_capture¶

Prevents analysis of capture fragment interactions

--subsample <subsample>¶

Subsamples reporters before analysis of interactions

Arguments

REPORTERS¶

Required argument

interactions-store¶

Parameters

Stores interaction counts.

ccanalyser interactions-store [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

bins¶

Parameters

Convert cooler file binned at the restriction fragment level to constant genomic windows.

param cooler_fn

Path to cooler file. Nested coolers can be specified by STORE_FN.hdf5::/PATH_TO_COOLER

type cooler_fn

os.PathLike

param output

Path for output binned cooler file.

type output

os.PathLike

param binsizes

Genomic window sizes to use for binning. Defaults to None.

type binsizes

Tuple, optional

param normalise

Normalise the number of interactions to total number of cis interactions (True). Defaults to False.

type normalise

bool, optional

param n_cores

Number of cores to use for binning. Performed in parallel by chromosome. Defaults to 1.

type n_cores

int, optional

param scale_factor

Scaling factor to use for normalising interactions. Defaults to 1e6.

type scale_factor

int, optional

param overlap_fraction

Minimum fraction to use for defining overlapping bins. Defaults to 1e-9.

type overlap_fraction

float, optional

ccanalyser interactions-store bins [OPTIONS] COOLER_FN

Options

-b, --binsizes <binsizes>¶

Binsizes to use for windowing

--normalise¶

Enables normalisation of interaction counts during windowing

--overlap_fraction <overlap_fraction>¶

Minimum overlap between genomic bins and restriction fragments for overlap

-p, --n_cores <n_cores>¶

Number of cores used for binning

--scale_factor <scale_factor>¶

Scaling factor used for normalisation

-o, --output <output>¶

Name of output file. (Cooler formatted hdf5 file)

Arguments

COOLER_FN¶

Required argument

fragments¶

Parameters

Stores restriction fragment interaction combinations at the restriction fragment level.

param counts

Path to restriction fragment interactions counts .tsv file.

type counts

os.PathLike

param fragment_map

Path to restriction fragment .bed file, generated with genome-digest command.

type fragment_map

os.PathLike

param output

Output file path for cooler hdf5 file.

type output

os.PathLike

param capture_name

Name of capture probe.

type capture_name

str

param capture_oligos

Path to capture oligos bed file.

type capture_oligos

os.PathLike

param genome

Name of genome used for alignment e.g. hg19. Defaults to “”.

type genome

str, optional

param suffix

Suffix to append to filename. Defaults to “”.

type suffix

str, optional

ccanalyser interactions-store fragments [OPTIONS] COUNTS

Options

-f, --fragment_map <fragment_map>¶

Required Path to digested genome bed file

-c, --capture_oligos <capture_oligos>¶

Required Path to capture oligos file

-n, --capture_name <capture_name>¶

Required Name of capture oligo to store

-g, --genome <genome>¶

Name of genome

--suffix <suffix>¶

Suffix to append after the capture name for the output file

-o, --output <output>¶

Name of output file. (Cooler formatted hdf5 file)

Arguments

COUNTS¶

Required argument

merge¶

Parameters

Merges ccanalyser cooler files together.

Produces a unified cooler with both restriction fragment and genomic bins whilst reducing the storage space required by hard linking the “bins” tables to prevent duplication.

param coolers

Cooler files produced by either the fragments or bins subcommands.

type coolers

Tuple

param output

Path from merged cooler file.

type output

os.PathLike

ccanalyser interactions-store merge [OPTIONS] COOLERS...

Options

-o, --output <output>¶

Output file name

Arguments

COOLERS¶

Required argument(s)

reporters-deduplicate¶

Parameters

Identifies duplicate aligned fragments and removes them.

ccanalyser reporters-deduplicate [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

identify¶

Parameters

Identifies read fragments with duplicate coordinates and outputs these to a json file.

param fragments_fn

Input fragments.tsv file to process.

type fragments_fn

os.PathLike

param output

Output path to output duplicated parental read ids. Defaults to “duplicated_ids.json”.

type output

os.PathLike, optional

param buffer

Number of fragments to process in memory. Defaults to 1e6.

type buffer

int, optional

param read_type

Process combined(flashed) or non-combined reads (pe). Due to the low confidence in the quaility of pe reads, duplicates are identified by removing any fragments with matching start and end coordinates. Defaults to “flashed”.

type read_type

str, optional

ccanalyser reporters-deduplicate identify [OPTIONS] FRAGMENTS_FN

Options

-o, --output <output>¶

File to output fragments with duplicated coordinates

--buffer <buffer>¶

Number of fragments to process at one time

--read_type <read_type>¶

Type of read

Options

flashed | pe

Arguments

FRAGMENTS_FN¶

Required argument

remove¶

Parameters

Removes duplicated fragments from slices file according to duplicated reads found by identify.

param slices_fn

Input slices.tsv file.

type slices_fn

os.PathLike

param duplicated_ids

Duplicated parental read ids in json format.

type duplicated_ids

os.PathLike

param output

Output file path for deduplicated slices. Defaults to “dedup.slices.tsv.gz”.

type output

os.PathLike, optional

param buffer

Number of slices to process in memory. Defaults to 1e6.

type buffer

int, optional

param sample_name

Name of sample being processed e.g. DOX-treated_1 used for statistics. Defaults to “”.

type sample_name

str, optional

param read_type

Process combined(flashed) or non-combined reads (pe) used for statistics. Defaults to “”.

type read_type

str, optional

param stats_prefix

Output path for deduplication statistics. Defaults to “”.

type stats_prefix

os.PathLike, optional

ccanalyser reporters-deduplicate remove [OPTIONS] SLICES_FN

Options

-d, --duplicated_ids <duplicated_ids>¶

Path to duplicated ids file

-o, --output <output>¶

Output file for deduplicated slices

--buffer <buffer>¶

Number of fragments to process at one time

--stats_prefix <stats_prefix>¶

Output prefix for stats file

--sample_name <sample_name>¶

Name of sample e.g. DOX_treated_1

--read_type <read_type>¶

Type of read

Options

flashed | pe

Arguments

SLICES_FN¶

Required argument

reporters-identify¶

Parameters

Removes all non-capture and non-reporter slices to identify reporters.

param bam

Input bam file to analyse

type bam

os.PathLike

param annotations

Annotations file generated by slices-annotate

type annotations

os.PathLike

param output_prefix

Output file prefix. Defaults to “reporters”.

type output_prefix

os.PathLike, optional

param stats_prefix

Output stats prefix. Defaults to “”.

type stats_prefix

os.PathLike, optional

param method

Analysis method. Choose from (capture|tri|tiled). Defaults to “capture”.

type method

str, optional

param sample_name

Sample being processed e.g. DOX-treated_1. Defaults to “”.

type sample_name

str, optional

param read_type

Process combined(flashed) or non-combined reads (pe) used for statistics. Defaults to “”.

type read_type

str, optional

param gzip

Compress output with gzip. Defaults to False.

type gzip

bool, optional

ccanalyser reporters-identify [OPTIONS] [capture|tri|tiled]

Options

-b, --bam <bam>¶

Required Bam file to process

-a, --annotations <annotations>¶

Required Annotations for the bam file. Generated by slices-annotate.

-o, --output_prefix <output_prefix>¶

Output prefix for deduplicated fastq file(s)

--stats_prefix <stats_prefix>¶

Output prefix for stats file(s)

--sample_name <sample_name>¶

Name of sample e.g. DOX_treated_1

--read_type <read_type>¶

Type of read

Options

flashed | pe

--gzip, --no-gzip¶

Determines if files are gziped or not

Arguments

METHOD¶

Required argument

slices-annotate¶

Parameters

Annotates a bed file using bedtools intersect.

Enables annotations with both names and counts at the same time whilst dealing with multimapping reads, which can lead to errors with reporter identification.

param slices

Input bed file.

type slices

os.PathLike

param actions

Methods to use for annotation. Choose from (get|count). Defaults to None.

type actions

Tuple, optional

param bed_files

Bed files to intersect with the bed file to be annotated. Defaults to None.

type bed_files

Tuple, optional

param names

Column names for output tsv file. Defaults to None.

type names

Tuple, optional

param overlap_fractions

Minimum overlap fractions required to call an intersection. Defaults to None.

type overlap_fractions

Tuple, optional

param output

Output file path for annotated .tsv file. Defaults to None.

type output

os.PathLike, optional

param duplicates

Method to deal with multimapping reads/duplicate bed names. Currently, “remove” is the only supported option. Defaults to “remove”.

type duplicates

str, optional

param n_cores

Number of corese to use for intersection. Bed files are split by chromosome for faster intersection. Defaults to 8.

type n_cores

int, optional

param invalid_bed_action

Action to deal with invalid bed files. Choose from (ignore|error) .These can be ignored by setting to “ignore”. Defaults to ‘error’.

type invalid_bed_action

str, optional

raises NotImplementedError

Only supported option for duplicate bed names is remove.

ccanalyser slices-annotate [OPTIONS] SLICES

Options

-a, --actions <actions>¶

Actions to perform for each bed_files file

Options

get | count

-b, --bed_files <bed_files>¶

Bed files to intersect with slices

-n, --names <names>¶

Names to use as column names

-f, --overlap_fractions <overlap_fractions>¶

Minimum overlap fractions

-o, --output <output>¶

Output file name

--duplicates <duplicates>¶

Method to use for reconciling duplicate (i.e. multimapping) slices

Options

remove

-p, --n_cores <n_cores>¶

Number of cores to use for intersections

--invalid_bed_action <invalid_bed_action>¶

Method to deal with invalid bed files

Options

ignore | error

Arguments

SLICES¶

Required argument
